div.head: Giles Cole. Will.
div.p:
In the name of God Amen. I Giles Cole of Charles County in the
provence of maryland planter being disparaleley wounded by the Susquehanna
Indians but of sound and perfect memory praised bee unto almighty God and
Knowing
knowing that all flesh must yeild unto Death when it shall please God
Almighty to call do make this my last will and testament in manner and form
following that is to say first and principally I commit my soul into the hands of
Almighty God my maker who gave it hoping through the meritorious
Death and passion of our blessed Savior Jesus Christ to receive free pardon
for all my sins past and my body to the earth to be desently buried from where
it Came and as for what wordly Estate God of his infinite goodness hath been
pleased to make me and of in this testimony I give and bequeath in
manner and form following.

First I give and bequeath unto John Hawkins Jun. one young stone horse of two
years and hald old to be delivered unto him after my decrease

Secondly. I give and bequeath unto Henry Hawkins brother of the above said John one gray mare
marked with HH together with all her future increase to him and his heirs forever
to be delivered unto him immedietly after my decease.

Thirdly I give and bequeath unto Elizabeth Hawkins sister unto the aforesaid brothers one
yearling cow calf to be delivered unto her after my decrease.

Fourthly I give and bequeath unto Thomas Hawkins Junior one stone calf of one years old next
grafs to be delivered unto him as above said.

Fifthly I give and bequeath unto my loving friend Stephen Coward two hog. de of Tobacco
Contayne eight hundred pounds to be paid him him out of my Crop after my
decease and one new Cloath waste of nusey one w. of emily Drawers one holland shirt
One holland neecloth and one shall.
Sixthly I give unto John Klumer eight hundred pounds of tobacco.
Seventhly I give unto Joseph the shoemaker all the rest of my warming cloths.

Eightly I do make Mr. Henry Hawkins Exs. of this my last will and testament to see it duly
performed for this pairs & are leaving after my Debts and Legacies being duly paid
I give unto him all the rest of my Estate and this to be taken for my last will and
testament and now other in testimony whereof I have hereunto set my hand and
seal this 7th day of Oct. in the year of our Lord 1675.

Signed and Sealed
In the presents of us
the of
Humphrey X Ones
right
the mark of
Hens. H. Hall.
the mark of
Giles Cole

On the back of the aforegoing will was the following probit (to will)
Oct. 27: 1675 Henry Hall made oath that he saw Giles Cole sign seal and
publish this as his last will and testament and that he was then around.
Disphering minde.
4 3/4 sides
Philip Calvert.
